snippet: Obama administration officials say they worry that the tax-filing season will generate new anger as uninsured consumers learn that they must pay tax penalties.
abstract: Obama administration officials have created 30 types of tax exemptions in effort to ease filing problems related to Affordable Care Act, and are considering adding more; law's advocates worry that penalties required of uninsured consumers will generate anger and that claiming tax credits used to pay for insurance in 2014 may prove complicated.
lead_paragraph: Obama administration officials say they worry that the tax-filing season will generate new anger as uninsured consumers learn that they must pay tax penalties.

headline.main: White House Seeks to Limit Health Law’s Tax Troubles
headline.print_headline: White House Seeks to Limit Health Law’s Tax Troubles

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
